description:
The third part of Durarara!!x2

As Mikado Ryuugamine continues to purge the Dollars from within in accordance with his warped sense of justice, Masaomi Kida hopes to bring his friend back to his senses by bringing the Yellow Scarves together once more. Little do they know that a far more dominant force is about to enter their struggle for power, one that their friend Anri Sonohara is all too familiar with.

Meanwhile, the group that has gathered at Shinra Kishitani's apartment realizes that they are on the brink of something life-changing, an event that will throw Ikebukuro into a spiral of confusion. Their anxiety is realized when reports of Celty's head being found in public start to appear all over the news as Kasane Kujiragi begins to make her move.

Gone are the brief periods of tranquility as the current turmoil sets the stage for one final performance in this thrilling conclusion to the story of Ikebukuro's finest.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohgo_narita)__

_Ryougo Narita_ is a Japanese light novelist and manga writer. He won the Gold Prize in the 9th Dengeki Novel Prize for Baccano!, which was made into an anime television series in 2007. His series Durarara!! was also made into two anime television series, one airing in January 2010 and the second in January 2015.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass

__Genres:__ Rock (Alternative Rock), Anison

__[Website](http://www.penguinresearch.jp/) | [Profile (SonyMusic)](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/penguinresearch/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZPSPAvxS6Kb_gLe_HYi94g)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PGR_info)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4jiOvoNgxnEvdlBwrx6o28)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist
- [Shouta Horie](https://anilist.co/staff/156564) (堀江晶太) – bass guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [John Kanda](https://anilist.co/staff/160031) (神田ジョン) – guitarist
- [Keita Shinbo](https://twitter.com/KeitaShinbo_PGR) (新保恵大) – drummer
- [Yosuke Shibazaki](https://twitter.com/yosuke_pgr) (柴﨑洋輔) – keyboardist

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

__Biography:__
PENGUIN RESEARCH, alternatively abbreviated PGR, is a Japanese five-piece rock band under record labels ultraCeep (2016–), SME Records (2016–) and Sacra Music (2017–). They made their major debut in 2016 with the release of their first full single titled "[Joker ni Yoroshiku](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SnoDBlVBLh4)", which initially aired as an ending in [Durararax2 Ketsu](https://anilist.co/anime/20880/Durararax2-Ketsu/).

__Members:__
- [Youji Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/153560/) (生田鷹司) – vocalist

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kemu8888)**

**Horie Shouta** is a Japanese lyricist, composer, arranger, bassist, pianoist and member of the five-piece rock band [PENGUIN RESEARCH](https://anilist.co/staff/120093).

__[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/KOHSHI_FLOW/)__

__Birthplace:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Brother:__ [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033)

__Kohsi__ (also known by full name Koushi Asakawa) is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist and member of rock band [FLOW](https://anilist.co/staff/100253/FLOW). He is also the older brother of Takeshi Asakawa, or better known as the lead guitarist of FLOW.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TAKE_FLOW)__

__Birthplace:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Brother:__ [Koushi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032)

__Take__ (also known by his real name Takeshi Asakawa) is a Japanese lyricist, composer, guitarist, programmer, choral composer and member of rock band [FLOW](https://anilist.co/staff/100253/FLOW). He is also the younger brother of Koushi Asakawa, or better known as one of the two vocalists of FLOW.

__[Website (pliom)](http://pliom.com/)__

__Toku__ (also known by his full name Yoshinori Abe) is a Japanese sound producer, arranger, composer and member of the pliom, and the duo [GARNiDELiA](https://anilist.co/staff/120052/GARNiDELiA). He is known for his sound producing work for artists such as [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561/LiSA), [Angela Aki](https://anilist.co/staff/101394/Angela-Aki) and [Antic Cafe](https://anilist.co/staff/100972/An-Cafe).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.
